intro: Oeonia brachystachyos, commonly known as the short-stalked featherflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. Oeonia brachystachyos is often found in coastal dunes and other dry, open habitats.
